channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large laughing gas canister needs to be disposed of appropriately, 24th January
item.description:
I found a large laughing gas canister in Rangefield Road. I have placed it on the ground directly beneath the litter bin, and beside the railings, outside Burnt Ash School.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rangefield Road, Sundridge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked pavement, 24th January
item.description:
White mercedes is blocking pavement. No chance to walk on. People have to walk on the road to avoid it. No respect to elderly people. It's been parking like this and blocking very often. Really annoying.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rookery Gardens, Poverest, Greater London

item.title: Yellow Barriers, 24th January
item.description:
There are 3/4 large yellow works barriers leaning up against the side of the Travelodge at this location. It looks like they've been left behind after recent works (?). There are also more of these yellow barriers dotted along the High Street at various places. These all look like they've been left behind because there aren't any works going on. There is another one just around the corner from this spot, up near the Bromley Road junction where Boots is.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 122-124, High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Entrance to mewes kept in unsanitary way, 24th January
item.description:
We keep having a serious issue with the mewes at the top of Park Avenue. The entrance, visible from the street where all bins are stored and collected regularly is in very unsanitary conditions with rubbish spread everywhere and now even bigger pieces of furniture. It's a very evident vermin and rats infestation hazard for those living there, the businesses selling food that are just below the flats, and all adjacent houses. The council must intervene in a serious and permanent manner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 370, Green Lanes, Palmers Green, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
